speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: Beyond the main controls, you can direct a performance using tags and punctuation directly within your script.

speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: The engine understands special tags for human sounds. For example, writing the word laughter in square brackets will cause the model to laugh.

speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: Other useful tags include 'breath', 'sigh', 'gasp', and 'clears throat'. For these to work reliably, you should always place spaces around the brackets.

speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: Punctuation is also a powerful tool for controlling rhythm. The A I will naturally pause at commas and periods.

speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: If you want to create a longer, more dramatic pause in a monologue, simply insert a line break, or an empty line, in the script.

speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: The model will interpret that empty line as a direction to pause, giving your scene a more natural, human feel.

speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: We have reached the end of our lessons. Please load the final chapter for some concluding words.
